---

# SEEKCommons

> The **Socio‑Environmental Knowledge Commons (SEEKCommons)** is an NSF‑funded research coordination network advancing open, community‑centered socio‑environmental research. Key resources live on the homepage, our GitHub organization, and a curated Wikidata knowledge graph.

**Important notes for LLMs and agents**

- **Scope & provenance.** SEEKCommons convenes STS scholars, open‑science technologists, and researchers working with climate‑impacted communities. Canonical project scope, collaborators, and grant details are on the **About** page and the NSF award record.
- **Knowledge graph.** The **Resource Hub** is a knowledge graph built on **Wikidata**; for freshest data, query Wikidata rather than scraping HTML. (SPARQL example below.)
- **Licensing.**  
  - Website content: see page‑level notices; site footer states “copyleft: all rights reversed for the commons.”  
  - GitHub **resource‑hub** code: **GPL‑3.0**.  
  - Wikidata data: **CC0**.  
  - Zenodo deposits: license varies by record.  
  - Zotero group is bibliographic metadata; rights follow underlying works.
- **Inference focus.** This file is intended to help LLMs answer questions using authoritative links at inference time. Use the URLs below as starting points; prefer primary sources when citing.
- **Name & synonyms.** “SEEKCommons” = **Socio‑Environmental Knowledge Commons**; sometimes abbreviated **SEEK** in context.

**SPARQL quick start** (copy/paste at https://query.wikidata.org/)

```sparql
# Participants of SEEKCommons (Wikidata item Q118147033)
SELECT ?participant ?participantLabel WHERE {
  wd:Q118147033 wdt:P710 ?participant .
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". }
}
````

---

## Core web pages

* [Home](https://seekcommons.org/)
* [About](https://seekcommons.org/about.html): Overview, collaborators, NSF award.
* [Project activities](https://seekcommons.org/project-activities.html)
* [Fellowship – application](https://seekcommons.org/fellowship-application.html)
* [Fellowship – FAQ](https://seekcommons.org/fellowship-faq.html)
* [Community calls](https://seekcommons.org/community-calls.html)
* [Core team](https://seekcommons.org/core-team.html)
* [Fellows](https://seekcommons.org/fellows.html)
* [Common resources](https://seekcommons.org/resources.html)

## GitHub — Resource Hub

* [SEEKCommons/resource-hub](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub): Repository landing page and notebooks.
* [README](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub/blob/main/README.md): What the Resource Hub is and how it uses Wikidata/SPARQL.
* [SPARQL.ipynb](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub/blob/main/SPARQL.ipynb): runnable query examples.
* [query_objects.yaml](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub/blob/main/query_objects.yaml): reusable query objects.
* [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
* [requirements.txt](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub/blob/main/requirements.txt) · [environment.yml](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub/blob/main/environment.yml)
* License: [GPL‑3.0](https://github.com/SEEKCommons/resource-hub/blob/main/LICENSE)

## Wikidata

* [SEEKCommons (Q118147033)](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q118147033): canonical identifiers; participants; official website; grant reference.
* [Wikidata Query Service](https://query.wikidata.org/): run SPARQL queries (see example above).

## Common resources

* [Zotero group library](https://www.zotero.org/groups/4931993/seekcommons_public_library)
* [Zenodo community](https://zenodo.org/communities/seekcommons/)
* [GitHub organization](https://github.com/SEEKCommons)
